example.text: Today in the Education and Workforce committee, the GOP is attempting to put a stop to [[user]]’ student debt relief plan which will provide economic relief for millions of struggling Americans and over 114,300 Floridians in District 24 who need it the most. We cannot allow this. [[url]]

The US is not a deadbeat nation. We have never failed to pay our bills. [[user]] and the and Democrats in Congress are leading the charge to avoid a default while ensuring Americans aren’t severely hurt by budget cuts like Republicans want. It’s time to put people over politics. [[url]]

Ensuring South Florida has quality transportation options is a top priority. Thanks to [[user]] Infrastructure Law, we’ve secured $71 million to replace and modernize Tri-Rail’s rail vehicles for our over 12,500 daily riders guaranteeing safer and more reliable transportation. ? [[url]]

Please, help me understand what is wrong with this Congress. Why is this education committee attacking public education? They have become anti-children, anti-teacher, anti-college, and anti-education. Who drank the Kool-Aid?? [[url]]
This year alone, our nation has experienced 201 mass shootings. This gun violence epidemic has claimed the lives of over 14,000. We are a country in crisis! When will enough be enough? [[url]]
As always, I will continue to advocate for support and guidance for Haiti and fight for a more democratic, secure, and stable future for all of its citizens, and it’s vibrant diaspora.
